field.label: Enabled
field.comment: Enables or disables the extension.

field.label: Pinterest Pixel ID
field.comment: Your Pinterest Pixel ID or comma-separated IDs. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip:
You can use multiple pixels and they will track the same information. There is no limit on the number of IDs. However, Pinterest does not recommend using multiple pixels on the same page.
"Using the track function on pages that have multiple pixels initialized (either using multiple base codes or even combining it within one base code) could produce over-firing or unexpected behavior and should be applied only in specific situations."

field.label: Add Pinterest Pixel To
field.comment: Type page handles (full action names) where you want Pinterest Pixel.
field.tooltip:
The page handles - Synonyms of the page type identifiers. Correspond to "full action names" of controller actions, for example, catalog_product_view
In this option you would type all handles where you want Pinterest Pixel to appear.

field.label: Enable Pinterest Pixel Base Code
field.comment: Enable Pinterest Pixel base code. WARNING! See the tooltip.
field.tooltip: This option enables Pinterest Pixel base code. The base code is required for Pinterest Pixel to function.

field.label: Enable noscript Tag
field.comment: Enable noscript tag. See the tooltip.
field.tooltip: This option enables noscript tag. The noscript tag defines an alternate content to be displayed to users that have disabled scripts in their browser or have a browser that does not support scripts. There is no need for noscript tag because Magento requires scripts to function.

field.label: Enable First-Party Cookies
field.comment: Enable first-party cookies. See the tooltip.
field.tooltip: This option enables first-party cookies. The Pinterest tag creates and accesses cookies in a first-party context on your site domain, providing better visibility into the Pinterest traffic on your site. If you want to delete the first-party cookies, set this option to "No". When you do this our extension will add 'fp_cookie': false to the Pinterest initialization code.

field.label: Enable Metadata Enrichment
field.comment: Enable metadata enrichment. See the tooltip.
field.tooltip: This option enables metadata enrichment. If you are using catalogs and shopping ads to showcase your products, Pinterest will use the tag to automatically update your product information to match the information on your website. This is referred to as metadata enrichment. If you want to disable the metadata enrichment, set this option to "No". When you do this our extension will add 'md_frequency': 0 to the Pinterest initialization code.

field.label: Enable AddToCart Event
field.comment: Enable AddToCart event. See the tooltip.
field.tooltip: This option enables the firing of the event. This is done with JavaScript in your visitor/customer web browser by the Pinterest Pixel.

field.label: Detect Selected SKU
field.comment: Try to detect selected SKUs for products. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip: This feature is heavily dependent on the theme you are using and its customization. It is impossible to predict all possible themes and customizations. Because of this detection will not work on every theme. This is why extension default configuration comes with this feature turned off. You can turn it on, try it out if it is working for you and if it does leave it on, otherwise turn it off. If you are a developer you will be pleased to know that everything is conveniently located in code.phtml file. To make it work, in some cases only the adjustment of few jQuery selectors is needed in others complete rewrite of detection code is needed. Because of this, we do not give any warranty for the detection feature, nor it is covered by our support service.
